channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Live updates: Deadly strikes in northern Gaza; Biden concerned after Israeli forces hit peacekeepers
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Ables, Victoria Bisset, Mohamad El Chamaa, Kelsey Baker
item.description: At least 19 people have been killed in Jabalya amid Israel’s siege in northern Gaza. President Biden said he was asking Israel to stop firing at U.N. peacekeepers in Lebanon.

item.title: Captured documents reveal Hamas’s broader ambition to wreak havoc on Israel
item.dc:creator: Joby Warrick, Souad Mekhennet, Loveday Morris

item.title: Captured documents reveal Hamas’s broader ambition to wreak havoc on Israel
item.dc:creator: Joby Warrick, Souad Mekhennet, Loveday Morris
item.description: Dozens of pages found by Israeli troops in Gaza detail a potential Hamas plan far bigger than the Oct. 7, 2023, attack.

item.title: What is UNIFIL? The U.N. peacekeeping force in Lebanon.
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall

item.title: What is UNIFIL, the U.N. peacekeeping force in Lebanon?
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall
item.description: The U.N. Interim Force in Lebanon has been patrolling the Israel-Lebanon border for more than 46 years.

item.title: Woman attempted to kayak to Canada with bag full of protected turtles
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall
item.description: Border Patrol agents in Vermont stopped the woman on the shore of Lake Wallace, on the U.S.-Canada border, with a duffel bag containing $40,000 worth of turtles.

item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger

item.title: Russia’s illicit Starlink terminals help power its advance in Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Alex Horton, Serhii Korolchuk, Eva Dou
item.description: Ukraine’s outgunned and outmanned army had one major advantage over its enemy: internet through Starlink terminals. Now the Russians have it, too.

item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan, Caleb Quinley, Yan Naing

item.title: No justice for Palestinian Americans killed in West Bank, families say
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger
item.description: Tawfic Abdel Jabbar and Mohammad Alkhdour – both 17-year-old U.S. citizens – were killed in the West Bank earlier this year. Their cases remain unsolved.

item.title: Uncertainty looms over Israel’s expected Iran strike; rescuers dig through debris in central Beirut
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Suzan Haidamous, Andrew Jeong, Adela Suliman, Steve Hendrix, Sammy Westfall
item.description: Israeli strikes on Beirut were the deadliest on Lebanon’s capitol since Oct. 8, 2023, when Hezbollah began its current barrage of rocket attacks on northern Israel.

item.title: U.N. convoy to evacuate patients fails to reach besieged northern Gaza
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Claire Parker, Heba Farouk Mahfouz , Hajar Harb
item.description: An Israeli military operation in northern Gaza is overwhelming hospitals but the United Nations and other medical groups were prevented from evacuating patients.

item.title: Dominican Republic expels over 10,000 Haitians, and plans to do so every week
item.dc:creator: Ana Herrero
item.description: The Dominican Republic’s deportation plan, which calls for 10,000 Haitians to be expelled every week, comes amid deteriorating relations between the two countries.

item.dc:creator: Michelle Lee, Kostiantyn Khudov, Isabelle Khurshudyan
item.description: Kim Jong Un has pledged “full support” for Russia’s Putin in his fight against Ukraine. Seoul and Kyiv say he’s now doing that by sending in military personnel.

item.dc:creator: Ellen Francis, Julia Mio Inuma
item.description: The Japanese group of atomic bomb survivors from Hiroshima and Nagasaki received the Nobel Prize for its efforts to achieve a world free of nuclear weapons.

item.description: Soldiers with pulverized bones and gunshot wounds have come through these facilities, with many focused on getting back to the front to stop the Russian advance.

item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Mohamad El Chamaa, Suzan Haidamous
item.description: The airstrikes are reviving criticism of Israel over its apparent tolerance for high civilian casualties in pursuit of military goals, rights groups say.

item.title: 22 killed in deadliest strike in central Beirut since start of war
item.dc:creator: Mohamad El Chamaa, Sammy Westfall, Suzan Haidamous, Mikhail Klimentov
item.description: Israeli strikes hit central Beirut on Thursday night in an attack local health officials said killed 22 people and injured 117.

item.title: Israel’s cabinet to vote on Iran response; U.N. says 2 peacekeepers injured in Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Andrew Jeong, Adela Suliman, Shira Rubin, Abbie Cheeseman, Steve Hendrix
item.description: Israel’s security cabinet will meet Thursday to vote on Israel’s response to Iran’s Oct. 1 missile attack. The U.N. said two peacekeepers were injured by Israeli fire.
